md:
giải nghĩa từ "shuts" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* shut (verb)
	+ Meaning: to close or fasten something, such as a door or a window, or to stop something from operating or functioning.
	+ Example: "She shut the door behind her."
	+ Related words: close, lock, seal, fasten
	+ Antonyms: open, unlock, unseal, unfasten

* shut (noun)
	+ Meaning: the act of closing or shutting something.
	+ Example: "The shut of the door was loud."
	+ Related words: closure, fastening, sealing, locking
	+ Antonyms: opening, unlocking, unsealing, unfastening

* shut (adjective)
	+ Meaning: closed or fastened.
	+ Example: "The shut window wouldn't open."
	+ Related words: closed, locked, sealed, fastened
	+ Antonyms: open, unlocked, unsealed, unfastened

* shut down (phrasal verb)
	+ Meaning: to stop operating or functioning, often temporarily.
	+ Example: "The company shut down due to financial difficulties."
	+ Related words: close down, cease, halt, stop
	+ Antonyms: start up, resume, restart, continue

* shut up (phrasal verb)
	+ Meaning: to stop talking or making noise.
	+ Example: "Shut up and listen to what I have to say."
	+ Related words: be quiet, hush, silence, quiet down
	+ Antonyms: speak up, talk, make noise, shout

* shut out (phrasal verb)
	+ Meaning: to exclude or prevent someone from participating or entering.
	+ Example: "The new policy shut out many qualified applicants."
	+ Related words: exclude, bar, block, prevent
	+ Antonyms: include, admit, allow, permit
html:
giải nghĩa từ "shuts" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

  • shut (verb)

    • Meaning: to close or fasten something, such as a door or a window, or to stop something from operating or functioning.
    • Example: "She shut the door behind her."
    • Related words: close, lock, seal, fasten
    • Antonyms: open, unlock, unseal, unfasten

  • shut (noun)

    • Meaning: the act of closing or shutting something.
    • Example: "The shut of the door was loud."
    • Related words: closure, fastening, sealing, locking
    • Antonyms: opening, unlocking, unsealing, unfastening

  • shut (adjective)

    • Meaning: closed or fastened.
    • Example: "The shut window wouldn't open."
    • Related words: closed, locked, sealed, fastened
    • Antonyms: open, unlocked, unsealed, unfastened

  • shut down (phrasal verb)

    • Meaning: to stop operating or functioning, often temporarily.
    • Example: "The company shut down due to financial difficulties."
    • Related words: close down, cease, halt, stop
    • Antonyms: start up, resume, restart, continue

  • shut up (phrasal verb)

    • Meaning: to stop talking or making noise.
    • Example: "Shut up and listen to what I have to say."
    • Related words: be quiet, hush, silence, quiet down
    • Antonyms: speak up, talk, make noise, shout

  • shut out (phrasal verb)

    • Meaning: to exclude or prevent someone from participating or entering.
    • Example: "The new policy shut out many qualified applicants."
    • Related words: exclude, bar, block, prevent
    • Antonyms: include, admit, allow, permit
